title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.40-41 | 15-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dasya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 40th and the 41st verses
The 40th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Suta Goswami is narrating this entire episode to the sage Srinayamisharanya.
Evam Parikshata Dharmam Parthaha Krishnena Choditaha
Naichad Hantum Guru Sutam Yadyapi Atmahanam Maha
Although Krishna, who was examining Arjuna in religion,
encouraged Arjuna to kill the son of Dronacharya,
Arjuna, a great soul, did not like the idea of killing him,
although Ashwatthama was a heinous murderer of Arjuna's family members.
You should not spare this Ashwatthama.
And specifically what is Krishna telling?
You must kill him because he is an aggressor.
He is a murderer of your family members.
So many good reasons for Arjuna to kill Ashwatthama.
and Ashwatthama is already bound up now.
arrested by Arjuna call his understood by Arjuna
so Arjuna could have killed, but Arjuna did not like the idea of killing the is no했어
Although Ashwathama deserved to be killed, still Arjuna did not like it because Arjuna is a great
soul. Mahan, he is described as Mahan. Actually devotees are called Mahatma. Devotees are great
souls. They are broad-minded. So, it is important to understand the consideration why Arjuna decided
not to kill Ashraf ville, Ashwathama. Schrina Prabhupada explains in the Purport to help us
understand better. Arjuna was a great soul.
undoubtedly which is proved here also in many instances in the mahabharata it is clearly
established the pandavas who are pure devotees of krishna the bhagavatam says any pure devotee
is full of all good qualities yes
all good qualities that have been found in demigods are fully present in a pure devotee
so arjuna is proved in this particular incident as we will see towards the end of this chapter
how arjuna justified not killing ashwathama even though ashwathama
deserved the death of krishna but he was not killed by krishna even though ashwathama deserved
the death of krishna but he was not killed by krishna even though ashwathama deserved the death of krishna
personally by the supreme lord krishna to kill the son of dronacharya this ashwathama who is
a murderer of arjuna's family members but arjuna considers that the son of his great teacher should
be spared for he happens to be the son of dronacharya even though he is an unworthy
son he has degraded himself arjuna ashwathama has degraded himself why because ashwathama has done
all sorts of heinous acts whimsically for no one's benefit what did he gain by doing this
ashwathama did not gain anything he could not please his master he didn't do the right thing
he was a aggressor assassin murderer
breaking the principles of kathriya conduct in a dharma yudha so he's definitely punishable
but what punishment that is the question krishna told arjuna you should kill him he should not spare
his life but arjuna is thinking how can i kill the son of my teacher whom he held in respect
now srilaprabha explains in the purport lord sri krishna encouraged arjuna outwardly
just to test arjuna's sense of duty
arjuna's sense of duty what is his duty in every circumstance a devotee performs his duty
in doing duty is the only thing that is difficult in doing the duty of your devotee
duty there is always a consideration how should i act in my position in terms of doing my duty
let go ashwathama arjuna has to punish as a matter of duty at the same time in doing the duty
he has to consider what kind of punishment does this son of the teacher of arjuna deserve
what kind of punishment does he deserve does he deserve the punishment of being killed
or some other punishment there is no doubt that he has to be punished
Arjuna has to punish Ashwathama. But what kind of punishment? That is elaborately discussed in the rest of the chapter.
It is not that Arjuna was incomplete in the sense of his duty. Nor was Lord Sri Krishna unaware of Arjuna's sense of duty.
Krishna knew. Arjuna is aware of his duty and he will act responsibly.
This is the difference between a devotee and a non-devotee.
A non-devotee under all circumstances acts responsibly.
A non-devotee may or may not be responsible in all his actions.
Because a non-devotee under the influence of the glaring material energy is carried away sometimes.
And will fail in properly doing his duty or fail in taking responsibility.
So unless one is a devotee of Krishna.
One will not be able to do his duties properly.
Now Srila Prabhupada says about the pure devotees.
Lord Sri Krishna put to test many of his pure devotees.
Just to magnify the sense of duty.
Krishna when he descends. He descends with his pure devotees.
And the pure devotees teach by their exemplary actions.
As much as Krishna himself teaches by his instructions.
And by his actions which he performs in his role.
When he does a, plays a role.
Then Krishna performs his duties or activities perfectly.
Now Srila Prabhupada gives the example of pure devotees.
Who were put to test by Krishna.
The gopis were put to such tests as well.
Not only Arjuna is being tested by Krishna now.
Earlier the gopis also were put to such tests.
Prahlad Maharaj was also put to such a test.
All pure devotees come out successful in their respective tests by the Lord.
Now let's understand how Prahlad Maharaj was put to test.
By the Supreme Lord Narasimha Dev.
Prahlad appeared as the son of a big demon.
A pure devotee appears in the family of demons.
And that is just for the sake of the deliverance of the demons.
That is Krishna's mercy upon even the demoniac nature persons.
Krishna's mercy is there on every living entity.
Because every living entity is his own part and parcel.
Eternally we are Krishna's own part and parcel.
yajnyatvana punarmoham evam yasyasi pandava sarvabhutani asheshani drakshasi atmano atomayi
In the fourth chapter Krishna says.
What is the transcendental knowledge that one has to.
That every living being is part and parcel of Krishna.
And therefore they belong to Krishna.
Prahlad Maharaj appeared as the son of Hiranyakashipu.
And when Hiranyakashipu came to know.
Hiranyakashipu became very angry against Prahlad.
Utter even the name of my enemy.
Why did Hiranyakashipu consider Vishnu as his enemy.
And he just told Prahlad don't ever utter.
He would always chant the name of the Supreme Lord.
Hiranyakashipu became more and more angry.
And he tried to stop his son.
Prahlad was chanting the holy name.
Prahlad was protected by the Supreme Lord.
And when Hiranyakashipu attempted to kill Prahlad.
He became very angry against Hiranyakashipu.
From further giving any trouble to.
Hiranyakashipu was delivered by the Supreme Lord.
And you have suffered so much.
At the hands of this demon.
I don't want any boon for myself.
